imdb.title: Girls Bravo
imdb.plot: Small for his age, Yukinari has been bullied and abused by girls all his life. Now in high school, he has developed a rare condition: whenever girls touch him, or even come close, he breaks out in hives. Imagine his surprise, when...

episodes.title: Bravo at the Pool!
episodes.plot: Fukuyama turns the school pool into a resort as means to get the girls all to himself. Things get out of hand when Fukuyama and Yukinari switch bodies with the help of Lisa's magic, and really out of hang when everyone switches bodies.

episodes.title: Fight Bravo!
episodes.plot: Fukuyama blackmails Kirie into an all girls fight club which involves skimpy outfits and mud fights.

episodes.title: First Date is Bravo!
episodes.plot: Yukinari and Miharu go out on a proper date, but things don't go as plan when she uses Fukuyama's book on dating as a guide, luckily Kirie helps out.

episodes.title: Clean Up Bravo!
episodes.plot: One of the students (Mamoru Machida) at the school wants to be a super hero to clean up trash at the school, with Lilica's help, he just might succeed.

episodes.title: As Long as We're Together Then Bravo!
episodes.plot: Tomoka and Fukuyama spy on Kirie as she runs into various men with amorous thoughts toward her. Tomoka ends up running away leaving the gang worried until Fukuyama comes to the rescue.

episodes.title: Bravo at the Part-time Job!
episodes.plot: The gang heads to a video game convention to make some extra money, but things go amiss when another girl doesn't show up for her job and Yukinari has to dress up as girl to help out, and "she" draws the attention of Fukuyama.

episodes.title: Bravo at Mahjong!
episodes.plot: Tomoka is bored so the gang ends up playing a different version of Mahjong with Fukuyama, the problem is the game involves skimpy outfits and rubbing of your opponents.

episodes.title: Rabbit Ears Bravo!
episodes.plot: Fukuyama creates a movie about the "Phantom Rabbits" for a school project.

episodes.title: School Festival is Bravo!
episodes.plot: A frustrated Maharu comes to earth to get an update on the search for her husband, needless to say the gang is surprised by her arrival. Her presence causes some disruptions, but she doesn't stay long.

episodes.title: Sunny Afternoon Bravo!
episodes.plot: Koyomi thinks she see her Dad on TV as the gang discuss the marks on Miharu's head, so the she goes off looking for him. The gang follows along and helps out after seeing Koyomi fail on her own, but trouble finds him before they do.

episodes.title: Present is Bravo!
episodes.plot: While Miharu is out shopping for her friends Yukinari loses his allergic reaction to girls. Once Miharu gets home she no longer feels special to Yukinari and decides to head back to Seiren with Hijiri.

episodes.title: Bravo to Seiren!
episodes.plot: The gang is saddened and angry over Miharu's return to Seiren, but with Koyomi's help they might just be able to go Seiren themselves.

episodes.title: Final Bravo!
episodes.plot: The final battle to rescue Mihura takes place on Seiren, not only Mihura's fate lies in the balance, but perhaps the fate of Seiren too.

episodes.title: Ofuroba kara burabô!
episodes.plot: Yukinari is transported to Seiren while fighting with Kirie. There he finds Miharu, a girl who has been watching him for some time. After exploring Seiren, getting chased by every woman, he heads back to earth with Miharu somehow in tow.

episodes.title: Gakkô de burabô!
episodes.plot: Still on earth, Miharu discovers food and the joy that goes along with eating it. On a search to find more she heads to Yukinari 's high school. Once there she draws the attention of Kazuharu, the ladies man of the school.

episodes.title: Kukkingu wa burabô!
episodes.plot: Yukinari runs into Lisa Fukuyama, who believes that he is her soul mate. At school Yukinari is kidnapped by her servants so she can marry him. At the ceremony things get a little complicated when a demon arrives and Miharu stops it.

episodes.title: Gôtei de burabô!
episodes.plot: Kirie wants to surprise Yukinari with some food she made, but instead the pair end up going after Miharu, who has taken a job at Fukuyama's mansion.

episodes.title: Ame no hi ni burabô! Zenpen
episodes.plot: An amnesiac girl (Koyomi) arrives from Seiren, she quickly draws the attention of Kazuharu which leads to a chase through the city. Koyomi's real reason for being on earth finally comes back to her as she regains her memory.

episodes.title: Ame no hi ni burabô! Kôpen
episodes.plot: Miharu voluntarily returns to Seiren with Koyomi leaving Yukinari in a sad state. After a brief stay Miharu returns with Koyomi and a surprise guest (Tomoka).

episodes.title: Omuko san sagashi de burabô!
episodes.plot: The gang is on a mission to find Miharu's sister (Maharu) a husband to go back to Seiren. After trying some unorthodox methods, Tomoka ends up running into Fukuyama who makes the trip to Seiren but is quickly rejected by Maharu.

episodes.title: Ippai de burabô!
episodes.plot: Miharu drinks alcohol in chemistry class causing her to create endless duplicates of herself with one mission, to eat everything in sight.

episodes.title: Ma'hô taisen de burabô!
episodes.plot: Tomoka uses magic to turn Ebi into a small girl which causes a magical feud between Tomoka and Lisa, as Kazuharu takes a shine on the small girl.

episodes.title: Onsen de burabô!
episodes.plot: The gang heads into the mountains to visit some hot springs which turn out to be dried up. While looking for another place to bathe they find a hot springs owned by the Fukuyamas and is host to a young female ghost who needs their help.

episodes.title: Pinpon de burabô!
episodes.plot: The stakes are high when the gang challenges Kazuharu Fukuyama to a ping pong match in order to use the hot springs without him in it or spying on them.
